MS MCQs

    Handle errors in Rust

    »

    1. Which of the following attempts will not cause a Rust program to panic?

      Accessing an out-of-bounds index of a vector with vector[index] notation.

      Accessing an out-of-bounds index of a vector with vector.get(index) notation.

      Accessing an out-of-bounds index of an array with array[index] notation.

      Accessing a non-existent key of a hash map with HashMap[key] notation.


    2. How can you represent the possibility of absence of a value of a given type, T, in Rust?

      The Option type.

      The Result<T, bool> type.

      A false value of the bool type.

      An empty tuple: ().


    3. How can you represent the possibility of input/output (I/O) failure when you’re obtaining a value of a given type, T?

      The Option type.

      The Result<T, io::Error> type.

      An empty Vec.

      An empty tuple: ().
